com.esri.mo2.data.feat
Class BaseFields

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.data.feat.BaseFields
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Fields, Serializable
public class BaseFields
extends Object
implements Fields, Serializable

A standard implementation of the Fields interface. Note: This implementation along with the underlying collection is not synchronized. User management is required in order be thread-safe.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructs a Field collection having no pre-set number of Fields.

BaseFields

public BaseFields(int numFields)
Constructs a Field collection with given number of Fields. This helps to allocate space in the underlying collection.

Parameters:
numFields - the initial capacity
Method Detail

clone

public Object clone()
Performs a "shallow" clone of this BaseFields. The Field objects are not cloned (for performance reasons).

Specified by:
clone in interface Fields
Overrides:
clone in class Object
Returns:
a copy of this BaseFields
See Also:

equals

public boolean equals(Fields fields)
For each Field in the given Fields, this method tries to find the same Field in this Fields.

Specified by:
equals in interface Fields
Parameters:
fields - the Fields to be compared
Returns:
True, if all Fields are found, else False, if any one Field not found or number of Fields is unequal.

findField

public int findField(String name)
Description copied from interface: Fields
Returns the index associated with the given Field's name. Normally, this will be a case-independent search.

Specified by:
findField in interface Fields
Returns:
the index of the Field found, or -1, if not found

findField

public int findField(Field f)
Description copied from interface: Fields
Returns the index of a Field that is equal to the specified Field. All properties of the Field objects are expected to be equal.

Specified by:
findField in interface Fields
Parameters:
f - the Field
Returns:
the index of the Field found, or -1, if not found

addField

public void addField(Field f)
Adds a reference to the specified Field in the collection. An attempt to add the same Field twice will be ignored.

Note: The Field is not cloned.

Parameters:
f - the Field to be added

addFields

public void addFields(Fields f)
Adds the specified Fields to the collection using the addField method for each member of the specified Fields. If you specify a null Fields, then this method will be ignored.

Note: The individual Field objects are not cloned.

Parameters:
f - the Fields to be added

removeField

public void removeField(Field f)
Removes the specified Field from the collection. Does nothing if the Field is not present.

Parameters:
f - the Field to be removed

removeAllFields

public void removeAllFields()
Removes all the Fields from the collection.

intersect

public static BaseFields intersect(Fields fs1,
                                   Fields fs2)
Returns a Fields objects that contains all the Field objects that are common to the given Fields.

Parameters:
fs1 - an input Fields object
fs2 - the other input Fields object
Returns:
a new Fields object containing all Field objects that are common to the input, or null if no common Field objects were found.
